thread.title: Police close case into alleged homophobic chanting by Manchester United fans at Chelsea
thread.title_full: Police close case into alleged homophobic chanting by Manchester United fans at Chelsea

author: James Whaling
title: Police close case into alleged homophobic chanting by Manchester United fans at Chelsea
text:
Sport Police close case into alleged homophobic chanting by Manchester United fans at Chelsea United supporters had been accused of chanting 'Chelsea rent boys' during the clash earlier this month which the Blues won 1-0 Share Chelsea won the FA Cup quarter-final clash (Photo: Getty Images Europe) Share Get Manchester United FC updates   
Police have closed their enquiries into alleged homophobic chanting by Manchester United fans during their FA Cup quarter-final defeat at Chelsea. 
United supporters were accused of chanting 'Chelsea rent boys' during the clash earlier this month which the Blues won 1-0 to book their place in the last four. 
The complaint, which is also being investigated by the FA, was made by a Chelsea fan following the match at Stamford Bridge. 
A police statement read: "Officers at Hammersmith and Fulham borough received an allegation on Tuesday, 14 March of homophobic chanting at the Chelsea v Manchester United football match at Stamford Bridge on Monday, 13 March. 
"Following initial police enquiries it was concluded that the matter did not meet the threshold for further investigation and the matter is now closed. United fans allegedly made the chants at Stamford Bridge (Photo: REUTERS) N'Golo Kante's goal won the tie for Chelsea (Photo: REUTERS) 
"Inspector John Childs of Hammersmith and Fulham Police said: â€œThe Met takes all allegations of homophobic chanting or behaviour very seriously and we investigate all matters brought to our attention. 
""We routinely work very closely with football clubs, national football associations and partner agencies to monitor behaviour to ensure public confidence and safety."" 
The chant has been used by opposition fans to goad Chelsea supporters for many years, and police launched enquiries into the matter but opted not to take action. Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
